channel.title: Compiler error
channel.description:
i do understand this is a common error but... i cant find any topics using the search button so can you please tell me. :D
well the error is this... "javac is not recognized as a internal or external command,operable program or batch file." please tell me how to fix

item.title: Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @Waffles1 Waffles!!
item.description:
@Waffles1 wrote:

They have to set CLASSPATH as well as PATH. They are called environmental variables, which increase the searching percentage.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Waffles!!, post:9, topic:154524”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=211088.msg1847201#msg1847201 date=1193476239]
Oh for pete sake.

Set your classpath, and then in the compile.bat file just do
javac *.java
pause

Is it really that hard?
[/quote]
It’s really that hard when you don’t give them any help.

Kid, set your environmental variables. Search it, or go to the tut section and read the sticky(have to scroll down a bit)[/quote]
Haha, aint it funny, you said virtually the exact same thing I said.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler error
item.dc:creator: @k0_twin k0 twin
item.description:
@k0_twin wrote:

I had that same error when first started, and i just used a different compiler and run.bat
give these a try

Compiler

@echo off
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
“%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe” http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

Run

@echo off
title Runserver
color 0e
java -Xmx512m -cp .;./Class; server

try others, find what works for you.

Read full topic
